main_definition: The word 'even' is a versatile English term with several meanings, including equal distribution or levelness; fairness in treatment or judgement; the number that comes after an odd number when counting by twos; and used to emphasize surprise or contrast.

meanings_and_examples.example: Evenly distributed tasks among team members.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to fairness in treatment or judgement
meanings_and_examples.example: She was an even-handed judge, considering all arguments equally.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used after odd numbers when counting by twos; refers to the number that follows an odd one
Used to emphasize surprise or contrast
meanings_and_examples.example: Even in the middle of a busy street, he managed to find his lost wallet.
